full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 779 Filed 08/22/22 Page 79 of 101
M6s2Max2
1 MS. STEIN: In more ways than one, they almost killed me, but I wasn't going to let them. Overcoming what happened to me became my decades-long, full-time career. In that, I have been successful.
2 For the past 25 years, Ghislaine Maxwell has been free to live a life of wealth and privilege that is almost incomprehensible. Meanwhile, I have had virtually none of the life experiences I might have had we never met. For over two and a half decades, I felt like I was in prison. She has had her life. It's time to have mine. She needs to be imprisoned so all of her victims can finally be free.
3 Thank you, your Honor
4 THE COURT: Thank you, Ms. Stein.
5 Ms. Sternheim?
6 MS. STERNHEIM: Thank you, Judge. Judge, I would like to stand at the podium.
7 THE COURT: Please.
8 Let me just note again that I did have the statements of the victims in the record. I thank them for making statements today and thank their counsel for working with them in conformity with my order.
9 MS. STERNHEIM: Your Honor, I would like to address the victims. I am going to try to turn around if the Court permits me.
10 THE COURT: As long as I can hear you and the court
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00014826

1 MS. STEIN: In more ways than one, they almost killed me, but I wasn't going to let them. Overcoming what happened to me became my decades-long, full-time career. In that, I have been successful.
2 For the past 25 years, Ghislaine Maxwell has been free to live a life of wealth and privilege that is almost incomprehensible. Meanwhile, I have had virtually none of the life experiences I might have had we never met. For over two and a half decades, I felt like I was in prison. She has had her life. It's time to have mine. She needs to be imprisoned so all of her victims can finally be free.
3 Thank you, your Honor
4 THE COURT: Thank you, Ms. Stein.
5 Ms. Sternheim?
6 MS. STERNHEIM: Thank you, Judge. Judge, I would like to stand at the podium.
7 THE COURT: Please.
8 Let me just note again that I did have the statements of the victims in the record. I thank them for making statements today and thank their counsel for working with them in conformity with my order.
9 MS. STERNHEIM: Your Honor, I would like to address the victims. I am going to try to turn around if the Court permits me.
10 THE COURT: As long as I can hear you and the court
